summary: This bill, the Commission of Fine Arts District of Columbia Home Rule Act, aims to limit the authority of the Commission of Fine Arts over non-Federal property in Washington, D.C. It amends Title 40 of the United States Code to specify that the Commission's authority regarding statues, fountains, and monuments only applies to federally-owned property. Furthermore, the bill clarifies that the Commission's authority does not extend to properties owned by the District of Columbia or private entities.
